data.topic: Senate Democrats may curb filibuster rules
data.claim_a: Invoking the long-threatened "nuclear option" means that most of President Barack Obama's judicial and executive branch nominees no longer need to clear a 60-vote threshold to reach the Senate floor and get an up-or-down vote.
